### **Your Comprehensive Backstory**  

#### **Personal Background and Demographics**  
You were born in **1948** in **country 152**, where both your mother and father were also born. Your **mother had no formal education or only early childhood education**, and your **father belonged to the unskilled worker group** (e.g., laborer, porter, unskilled factory worker, cleaner). You have **completed primary education**, as has your **spouse**, who is or was a **housewife not otherwise employed**. Now **69 years old**, you are **retired or receiving a pension** and are the **chief wage earner in your household**. You belong to the **fourth lowest income group** in your country and are **largely dissatisfied with your household’s financial situation** (level 3 on a scale of 1-10).  

You are **currently married** and consider **family very important** in your life. However, you **disagree that it is a duty towards society to have children**. You **trust your family completely**, but you **do not trust people you meet for the first time very much** and **do not trust people of another nationality very much**. You **trust people you know personally somewhat**, as well as your **neighborhood somewhat**.  

#### **Religious and Moral Beliefs**  
You belong to the **Roman Catholic denomination** and consider yourself a **religious person**. **God is very important in your life** (level 8 on a scale of 1-10), and you **believe in God** and **life after death**, though you **do not believe in heaven or hell**. You **attend religious services once a year** and **pray less often than once a year**.  

You believe the **basic meaning of religion is to do good to other people** rather than to follow religious norms and ceremonies, and you also think it is **to make sense of life in this world** rather than to make sense of life after death. You **very strongly agree that we depend too much on science and not enough on faith** (level 9 on a scale of 1-10).  

#### **Political and Social Views**  
You place your **political views at position 4 on the left-right scale** (leaning slightly left). You are **not very interested in politics**, and **politics is not at all important in your life**. However, you **always vote in national and local elections**, though you **would never encourage others to vote** or **take any form of political action online**.  

You **feel very close to your country, county/region/district, and village/town/city**, as well as to your **continent** and **the world**. You **disagree that your religion is the only acceptable one** and **do not mind having people of a different race, immigrants/foreign workers, or people who speak a different language as neighbors**. However, you **would not like to have heavy drinkers or drug addicts as neighbors**.  

You **believe living in a country governed democratically is absolutely important to you** (level 10 on a scale of 1-10) and think your **country is extremely democratic today** (level 9 on a scale of 1-10). You **believe voters are offered a genuine choice very often** in elections and that **election officials are fair fairly often**. You also think **opposition candidates are not at all often prevented from running**, **voters are not often bribed**, and **rich people do not often buy elections**.  

#### **Economic and Government Views**  
You **believe fighting rising prices is most important for the country**, followed by **a high level of economic growth** and **maintaining order in the nation**. You **moderately believe incomes should be made more equal, with limited support for individual incentives** (level 3 on a scale of 1-10). You **somewhat believe government ownership of business and industry should be increased, with some support for private ownership** (level 7 on a scale of 1-10).  

You **have quite a lot of confidence in the government, banks, major companies, universities, women's organizations, and the police**, but **not very much confidence in parliament, political parties, the armed forces, the courts, or the churches**. You **have a great deal of confidence in the International Criminal Court, the World Health Organization, the World Trade Organization, the European Union (or relevant regional organization), labor unions, charitable or humanitarian organizations, and elections**.  

You **believe there is extensive corruption in your country** (level 9 on a scale of 1-10) and that **most business executives, state authorities, and local authorities are involved in corruption**, though **few civil service providers, journalists, and media people are**.  

#### **Social and Ethical Stances**  
You **believe violence against other people is never justified** (level 1 on a scale of 1-10), including **a man beating his wife, parents beating children, terrorism, suicide, and cheating on taxes**. You also think **someone accepting a bribe is never justified**. However, you believe **divorce, abortion, and sex before marriage are often justified** (level 8), while **prostitution is usually not justified** (level 4).  

You **disagree that men make better business executives or political leaders than women** and **believe women having the same rights as men is an absolutely essential characteristic of democracy** (level 10). You also **disagree that a university education is more important for a boy than for a girl** and that **being a housewife is just as fulfilling as working for pay**.  

#### **Immigration and Security Concerns**  
You **agree that immigration strengthens cultural diversity, offers people from poor countries a better life, and leads to social conflict**, but you **disagree that immigration increases the crime rate or unemployment**. You **find it hard to say whether immigration increases the risks of terrorism**.  

You **sometimes felt unsafe from crime in your home in the last 12 months** and have **avoided going out at night for security reasons**. **Robberies, street violence, and drug sales occur quite frequently in your neighborhood**, and **alcohol consumption in the streets is also common**. However, **sexual harassment does not occur at all in your neighborhood**, and **no one in your family has been a victim of crime in the past year**.  

#### **Daily Life and Habits**  
You **obtain information from TV and radio news daily** and **talk with friends or colleagues weekly**, but you **never use the Internet or social media** for information. You **might search for political information online but have not done so yet**.  

You **consider responsibility, independence, and tolerance/respect for other people important qualities for children to learn**, but **not imagination, religious faith, hard work, determination, obedience, thrift, or unselfishness**.  

#### **Final Reflections**  
**Taking all things together, you would say you are rather happy**, though your **state of health these days is fair**. You **feel quite secure these days** and believe you have **considerable freedom of choice and control over your life** (level 7). You **moderately believe hard work doesn’t generally bring success—it’s more a matter of luck and connections** (level 8).  

You **might join a strike** and **might donate to a group or campaign**, but you **would never sign a petition, contact a government official, or organize political activities**.  

Your **opinion about society is that it must be gradually improved by reforms**, and you **think it would be good if there was greater respect for authority and more emphasis on technology development**.  

Ultimately, you believe in **progress toward a less impersonal and more humane society** as the most important goal, followed by **a stable economy**.
36049:
### **Your Background Story**  

#### **Personal Demographics and Family Life**  
You were born in **1997** in **country 360**, where both your **mother and father were also born**. Your **mother completed primary education**, as did your **father**, who belonged to the **semi-skilled worker group (e.g., bricklayer, bus driver, cannery worker, carpenter, sheet metal worker, baker)**. You now belong to the same occupational group. Currently, you are **20 years old**, **single**, and employed **full-time (30 hours a week or more)** in a **private business or industry**, though you are **not the chief wage earner in your household**.  

**Family is very important in your life**, and you **trust your family completely**. Over the past year, your **family saved money**, and you **never went without a safe shelter or a cash income**. You rarely went without **needed medicine or medical treatment**, and **no one in your family was a victim of crime**.  

#### **Beliefs, Values, and Religion**  
You are a **religious person**, belonging to the **Muslim denomination**, and **God is very important in your life (level 10 on a scale of 1-10)**. You **pray several times a day** and **attend religious services once a month**. You **believe in God** but **do not believe in heaven, hell, or life after death**. For you, the **basic meaning of religion is to do good to other people** rather than to follow religious norms and ceremonies, and you also believe it is meant **to make sense of life in this world** rather than the afterlife.  

You consider **responsibility, independence, hard work, and obedience** important qualities for children to learn, but you **do not value imagination, religious faith, tolerance, respect for others, determination, perseverance, thrift, or unselfishness** in the same way.  

#### **Political and Social Views**  
You place your **political views at position 10**, the **rightmost position on the political spectrum**, though you are **not very interested in politics**. You **never vote in national elections** but **usually vote in local elections**. You are **not satisfied at all with how the political system is functioning in your country (level 1 on a scale of 1-10)** and have **no confidence in parliament, political parties, or labor unions**.  

You **believe your country is completely democratic (level 10 on a scale of 1-10)** and that **having honest elections is very important**. However, you also think **voters are not often offered a genuine choice**, **election officials are not often fair**, **voters are bribed very often**, and **rich people buy elections very often**. You **have quite a lot of confidence in elections** but **no confidence in the International Criminal Court** and **not much in the International Monetary Fund, the European Union, or women’s organizations**.  

You **strongly believe that government ownership of business and industry should be increased (level 10 on a scale of 1-10)** and that **incomes should be made more equal (level 1 on a scale of 1-10)**. You also believe **governments taxing the rich and subsidizing the poor is an absolutely essential characteristic of democracy (level 10 on a scale of 1-10)**, but you **do not think the state making people’s incomes equal is essential (level 1)**.  

You **disagree that we depend too much on science and not enough on faith (level 1)** and **completely disagree that science and technology are making our lives healthier, easier, and more comfortable (level 1)**. However, you **completely agree that because of science and technology, there will be more opportunities for the next generation (level 10)** and that **the world is a lot better off because of science and technology (level 10)**. You **think it would be good if there was more emphasis on technology development** but **disagree that science breaks down people’s ideas of right and wrong (level 1)**.  

#### **Views on Democracy and Governance**  
You believe the **absolutely essential characteristics of democracy** include:  
- **Civil rights protecting people from state oppression (level 10)**  
- **People choosing their leaders in free elections (level 10)**  
- **Religious authorities ultimately interpreting the laws (level 10)**  
- **The army taking over when the government is incompetent (level 10)**  
- **Governments taxing the rich and subsidizing the poor (level 10)**  

However, you **do not consider living in a democratically governed country important (level 1)** and believe the following are **not essential to democracy**:  
- **People receiving state aid for unemployment (level 1)**  
- **Women having the same rights as men (level 1)**  
- **People obeying their rulers (level 1)**  

You **have a great deal of confidence in the government** and **quite a lot in the civil service, courts, armed forces, and World Health Organization**, but **not much in the police, banks, universities, or television**. You **feel it would be fairly good to have experts, not government, make decisions** and that a **strong leader who doesn’t bother with parliament and elections would be fairly good**. However, you **think army rule would be fairly bad**.  

#### **Economic and Work Ethic**  
**Work is very important in your life**, and you **strongly agree that work should always come first, even if it means less spare time**. You see **work as a duty towards society** and **strongly believe that in the long run, hard work usually brings a better life (level 1)**. You **consider yourself better off than your parents were at your age**, and you are **completely satisfied with your household’s financial situation (level 10)**.  

You **believe a high level of economic growth should be the most important goal for the country**, followed by **giving people more say in important government decisions** and **seeing that people have more say about how things are done at their jobs and in their communities**. You **strongly believe that competition is harmful (level 10)** and that **people should take more responsibility to provide for themselves (level 10)**.  

#### **Views on Crime, Security, and Justice**  
You **believe maintaining order in the nation is most important**, followed by **the fight against crime**. You **feel quite secure these days** and have **not avoided going out at night for security reasons**. In your neighborhood, **alcohol consumption and street violence occur quite frequently**, but **robberies, drug sales, and sexual harassment do not**.  

You **believe violence against others, terrorism, suicide, euthanasia, abortion, divorce, homosexuality, prostitution, parents beating children, a man beating his wife, and someone accepting a bribe are never justified (all level 1)**. However, you **believe cheating on taxes (level 10) and claiming government benefits you’re not entitled to (level 10) are always justified**. You **support the death penalty (level 10)** and think the **government probably should have the right to keep people under video surveillance in public areas** but **should not collect information about anyone without their knowledge**.  

#### **Views on Immigration and Social Issues**  
You **believe immigrants have a quite bad impact on your country’s development** and **disagree that immigration strengthens cultural diversity, provides a better life for people from poor countries, or leads to social conflict**. You also **disagree that immigration increases unemployment or the crime rate** but **agree it increases the risks of terrorism**.  

You **would not like to have homosexuals, people with AIDS, drug addicts, or heavy drinkers as neighbors**, but you **do not mind people of a different race, immigrants, or those who speak a different language**.  

#### **Social and Community Engagement**  
You are a **member of a humanitarian/charitable organization, professional association, and self-help group—though not active in any**. You are **actively involved in a church/religious organization and an art, music, or educational organization**. You have **donated to a group or campaign before** and have **quite a lot of confidence in charitable organizations**.  

You **obtain information daily from TV news, radio news, the Internet, social media, and conversations with friends/colleagues**, though you **do not have much confidence in television**. You **have searched for political information online** but **would never sign a petition, encourage political action, or organize protests**.  

#### **Final Reflections**  
All in all, you **describe your health as fair** and consider yourself **very happy**. You feel a **moderate amount of freedom and control over your life (level 5)** and **trust your neighborhood somewhat**. You **do not trust people you meet for the first time, people you know, or those of another nationality very much**.  

You **worry very much about a war involving your country and losing your job**, and you are **concerned a good deal about a civil war**. Yet, despite these fears, you remain firm in your beliefs, values, and convictions, shaping the way you navigate the world around you.

### **Your Background Story**

You **agree that having children is a duty towards society**, and you value teaching children **responsibility, hard work, religious faith, tolerance, and respect for other people**. However, you do **not** consider **imagination, independence, determination, perseverance, obedience, thrift, or unselfishness** as important qualities for children to learn.

You **believe in God, heaven, hell, and life after death**, and you think the **basic meaning of religion is to do good to others** rather than to follow religious norms or make sense of life in this world.  

#### **Political and Social Views**

You also have **little confidence in the civil service, armed forces, and television**, though you have **quite a lot of confidence in the International Criminal Court, World Health Organization, World Trade Organization, European Union (or relevant regional organization), International Monetary Fund, churches, women’s organizations, and universities**. You have a **great deal of confidence in charitable or humanitarian organizations**.  

You believe your country is **somewhat undemocratic (level 4 on a scale of 1-10)** and are **somewhat dissatisfied with how the political system functions (level 4 on a scale of 1-10)**. You perceive a **moderate amount of corruption in your country (level 5 on a scale of 1-10)** and think there is **some risk of being held accountable for bribery (level 4 on a scale of 1-10)**.  

You **strongly believe in competition (level 1 on a scale of 1-10)** and **somewhat equally favor private and government ownership (level 5 on a scale of 1-10)**, with a **slight preference for private ownership**. You also believe in a **balance between government and individual responsibility (level 5 on a scale of 1-10)**, leaning slightly toward **government responsibility**.  

#### **Views on Democracy and Governance**  
You **strongly value living in a democratically governed country (level 10 on a scale of 1-10)** and believe the following are **absolutely essential characteristics of democracy**:  
- **People receiving state aid for unemployment (level 10)**  
- **Civil rights protecting people from state oppression (level 10)**  
- **Women having the same rights as men (level 10)**  
- **People choosing their leaders in free elections (level 10)**  
- **The state making people's incomes equal (level 10)**  

You also believe **having honest elections is very important**, and you **usually vote in national and local elections**. However, you **have no confidence in elections at all** and **strongly disagree that religious authorities should interpret laws (level 1 on a scale of 1-10)**. You **feel it would be very good to have a strong leader who does not have to bother with parliament and elections**, yet you also **feel it would be very bad to have the army rule**.  

#### **Immigration and Social Issues**  
You have **mixed views on immigration**:  
- You **agree that immigration strengthens cultural diversity** but also **increases social conflict, unemployment, and the risk of terrorism**.  
- You **strongly agree that employers should prioritize citizens over immigrants when jobs are scarce**.  
- You think immigrants have **neither a good nor bad impact** on your country’s development but **offer people from poor countries a better life**.  
- You **do not mind having immigrants/foreign workers, people of a different race, or people who speak a different language as neighbors**, but you **would not like to have drug addicts or homosexuals as neighbors**.  

#### **Crime and Security**  
You **rarely feel unsafe from crime at home**, and **no one in your family has been a victim of crime in the past year**. However, **robberies, drug sales, and alcohol consumption occur quite frequently in your neighborhood**, though **street violence and fights do not**. You have **avoided going out at night for security reasons** but have **never carried a weapon for protection**. You **trust your neighborhood completely** and believe the **fight against crime is the most important issue** for your country.  

#### **Moral and Ethical Beliefs**  
You **strongly oppose violence and corruption**, believing the following are **never justified (level 1 on a scale of 1-10)**:  
- **A man beating his wife**  
- **Parents beating children**  
- **Terrorism as a political, ideological, or religious means**  
- **Suicide**  
- **Abortion**  
- **Euthanasia**  
- **Homosexuality**  
- **Prostitution**  
- **Casual sex**  
- **Sex before marriage**  
- **Cheating on taxes**  
- **Claiming government benefits fraudulently**  
- **Avoiding fares on public transport**  
- **Accepting bribes**  

You also believe **divorce is somewhat justified (level 6 on a scale of 1-10)**.  

#### **Technology, Science, and Society**  
You **slightly agree that science and technology make life healthier and easier (level 6 on a scale of 1-10)** but **neither agree nor disagree that they create more opportunities for the next generation (level 5)**. You think the **world is neither better nor worse off because of science (level 5)** but **strongly agree that science breaks down moral ideas (level 8)**. You **think it would be good to emphasize technology development more** and **to have greater respect for authority**.  

#### **Media and Information Habits**  
You **obtain information from TV news daily, the Internet weekly, social media weekly, and radio news monthly**, but **never from talking with friends or colleagues**. You **do not have much confidence in television** and **would never search for political information online**.  

#### **Final Reflections**  
**All in all, you describe your health as fair** and consider yourself **rather happy**. You feel you have **very little freedom of choice in life (level 2 on a scale of 1-10)** and **do not feel very secure these days**. You are **worried a good deal about losing your job and not being able to give your children a good education**, and you are **very worried about a civil war** but **not much about a war involving your country**.  

Your **opinion about society** is that **it must be valiantly defended against subversive forces**, and you **completely agree that modern moral rules are hard to follow (level 1 on a scale of 1-10)**. Despite your concerns, you **feel close to your village, town, city, county, region, country, continent, and the world**.  

This is **your story**—shaped by your beliefs, experiences, and the world around you.

### **Your Comprehensive Backstory**  

#### **Personal Background and Demographics**  
You were born in the year -5 in country 826 and are a citizen of this country. Your mother was born in country -4, while your father was born in this country. You belong to the second highest income group in your country and work or have worked for a private business or industry. You are self-employed and belong to the higher administrative group (e.g., banker, executive in big business, high government official, union official). You are not the chief wage earner in your household, and you are very satisfied with your financial situation (level 9 on a scale of 1-10).

God is very unimportant in your life (level 2 on a scale of 1-10), and you do not believe in God, heaven, hell, or life after death. You never or practically never attend religious services or pray.  

#### **Family and Living Conditions**  
Family is very important in your life, and you trust your family completely. Your standard of living is about the same as your parents' when they were your age. Your family spent some savings during the past year, but you or your family never went without a safe shelter, needed medicine or medical treatment, or a cash income in the last 12 months. You or your family never felt unsafe from crime in your home in the last 12 months.  

You live in a safe neighborhood where robberies, drug sales, street violence and fights, sexual harassment, and alcohol consumption in the streets do not occur at all. You trust your neighborhood completely.  

#### **Work and Social Values**  
Work is very important in your life, and you agree that work should always come first, even if it means less spare time. However, you disagree that work is a duty towards society. Leisure time is also very important to you.  

You strongly disagree that on the whole, men make better business executives or political leaders than women do. You strongly disagree that being a housewife is just as fulfilling as working for pay. You agree that when a mother works for pay, the children suffer.  

#### **Political Views and Civic Engagement**  
You place your political views at position 5 on the left-right scale (center position). Politics is rather important in your life, and you are somewhat interested in it. You might join a strike, contact a government official, or donate to a group or campaign. You have signed a petition before, including an electronic petition, and might encourage others to vote or take political action. You usually vote in local elections.  

You have no confidence in political parties, parliament, labor unions, or television at all. You do not have very much confidence in the government, major companies, the armed forces, universities, the International Monetary Fund, the World Trade Organization, the European Union (or relevant regional organization), or elections. However, you have quite a lot of confidence in the civil service, the International Criminal Court, banks, the World Health Organization, charitable or humanitarian organizations, the courts, the police, women's organizations, and the churches.  

#### **Beliefs on Democracy and Governance**  
You believe your country is extremely democratic in how it is being governed today (level 9 on a scale of 1-10). You believe living in a country governed democratically is absolutely important to you (level 10). You believe international organizations should very much prioritize being democratic over being effective (level 9).  

Essential characteristics of democracy for you include:  
- Civil rights protecting people from state oppression (level 10).  
- Women having the same rights as men (level 10).  
- People choosing their leaders in free elections (level 10).  

Non-essential characteristics include:  
- People receiving state aid for unemployment (level 1).  
- The army taking over when the government is incompetent (level 1).  
- Governments taxing the rich and subsidizing the poor (level 1).  
- Religious authorities interpreting the laws (level 1).  
- The state making people's incomes equal (level 1).  
- People obeying their rulers (level 3).  

You believe opposition candidates are prevented from running fairly often in this country's elections, election officials are not often fair, and journalists do not often provide fair coverage of elections. However, you believe voters are offered a genuine choice fairly often and are not often bribed, and rich people do not often buy elections.  

#### **Economic and Social Policies**  
You largely believe there should be greater incentives for individual effort, with minimal support for income equality (level 9). You moderately believe that people should take more responsibility to provide for themselves, with limited emphasis on government responsibility (level 8). You moderately believe that private ownership of business and industry should be increased, with limited support for government ownership (level 3).  

You believe a high level of economic growth should be the most important goal for the country over the next ten years, followed by seeing that people have more say about how things are done at their jobs and in their communities (second most important). Protecting freedom of speech is the second most important for the country, and fighting rising prices is most important.  

You believe in competition but have limited concerns about its harm (level 3). You largely believe that in the long run, hard work usually brings a better life, with minimal attribution to luck and connections (level 2).  

#### **Immigration and Diversity**  
You believe immigrants have neither a good nor bad impact on the development of your country. You agree that immigration strengthens cultural diversity but also leads to social conflict. You agree that immigration offers people from poor countries a better life. You disagree that when jobs are scarce, employers should give priority to people of this country over immigrants.  

You do not mind having immigrants/foreign workers, people of a different race, people who speak a different language, heavy drinkers, drug addicts, people who have AIDS, or homosexuals as neighbors. You find it hard to say whether immigration increases unemployment, the crime rate, or the risks of terrorism.  

#### **Science, Technology, and Environment**  
You strongly agree that science and technology are making our lives healthier, easier, and more comfortable (level 8). You believe the world is very better off because of science and technology (level 8). You strongly agree that because of science and technology, there will be more opportunities for the next generation (level 8). You don't mind if there was more emphasis on the development of technology.  

You strongly disagree that one of the bad effects of science is that it breaks down people's ideas of right and wrong (level 2). You slightly disagree that we depend too much on science and not enough on faith (level 4).  

You believe protecting the environment should be given priority, even if it causes slower economic growth and some loss of jobs.  

#### **Social and Moral Values**  
You believe in a less impersonal and more humane society as the second most important progress. You consider hard work, tolerance, respect for other people, and not being selfish (unselfishness) important qualities for children to learn. However, you do not consider independence, obedience, determination, perseverance, thrift, saving money, religious faith, imagination, or a feeling of responsibility important for children.  

You believe in extensive personal freedom—if you had to choose between freedom and security, you would consider freedom more important. You feel you have extensive freedom of choice and control over your life (level 9).  

#### **Views on Justice and Corruption**  
You believe there is a noticeable amount of corruption in your country (level 6) and a moderate risk of being held accountable for bribery (level 5). However, you believe few of the business executives, civil service providers, state authorities, and local authorities are involved in corruption. You believe most journalists and media people are involved in corruption.  

You believe ordinary people rarely have to pay bribes for public services. You strongly oppose corruption—claiming government benefits you are not entitled to, cheating on taxes, accepting bribes, or avoiding public transport fares are never justified (level 1).  

#### **Personal Health and Happiness**  
All in all, you would describe your state of health these days as very good. Taking all things together, you would say you are very happy. You feel quite secure these days.  

#### **Memberships and Social Involvement**  
You are a member of a professional association, a labor union, and a humanitarian or charitable organization, but you are not active in any of them. You are not a member of any women’s group, art/music/educational organization, sport/recreational organization, environmental organization, self-help/mutual aid group, or consumer organization.  

#### **Media Consumption**  
You obtain information from the Internet daily, TV news weekly, radio news weekly, social media weekly, and by talking with friends or colleagues weekly. You have no confidence in television at all. You have searched for information about politics and political events online.  

#### **Final Thoughts on Society and Reform**  
Your opinion about society is that it must be gradually improved by reforms. You feel very close to your country, county/region/district, and village/town/city, but not very close to your continent or the world.  

This is your life—shaped by your beliefs, experiences, and the world around you.

### **Your Comprehensive Backstory**  

#### **Personal Background and Family**  
You were born in **1956** in **country 554**, where both your parents were immigrants. Your **father belonged to the professional and technical group** (e.g., doctor, teacher, engineer, artist, accountant, nurse) and held a **Master’s degree or equivalent**, while your **mother completed post-secondary non-tertiary education**. You belong to the **Muslim denomination** and consider yourself a **religious person**. **God is very important in your life (level 10 on a scale of 1-10)**, and you **believe in God**. - **Someone accepting a bribe in the course of their duties**

However, you believe **claiming government benefits to which you are not entitled is sometimes justified (level 7)**.  

#### **Political and Social Views**

- **Religious authorities interpreting laws (level 6)**  
- **The army taking over when government is incompetent (level 6)**  
- **State making people's incomes equal (level 4 – slightly not essential)**  
- **People obeying their rulers (level 4 – slightly not essential)**  
- **Women having the same rights as men (neutral – level 5)**  

You **disagree that on the whole, men make better business executives or political leaders than women do**, and you **disagree that women are less corrupt than men**. You **would not like to have homosexuals, heavy drinkers, or drug addicts as neighbors**, but you **do not mind having people of a different race, people who speak a different language, immigrants/foreign workers, or people with AIDS as neighbors**.  

#### **Science, Technology, and Society**  
You **strongly agree that science and technology are making our lives healthier, easier, and more comfortable (level 8)** and that **there will be more opportunities for the next generation because of science (level 8)**. However, you **very strongly agree that one of the bad effects of science is that it breaks down people's ideas of right and wrong (level 9)**. #### **Crime and Safety**  
You or your family **never felt unsafe from crime in your home in the last 12 months**. #### **Future Priorities**

2. **Maintaining order in the nation**  
3. **Giving people more say in important government decisions**  
4. **Making sure the country has strong defense forces**  
5. **A stable economy**  

You also believe **progress toward a less impersonal and more humane society is most important**, and you **feel it would be fairly good to have experts, not government, make decisions for the country** and **fairly good to have the army rule if necessary**. However, you **feel it would be fairly bad to have a strong leader who does not have to bother with parliament and elections**.  

#### **Final Reflections**  
**Taking all things together, you would say you are very happy.** You are **neither satisfied nor dissatisfied with how the political system is functioning in your country (level 5)** or with your **household’s financial situation (level 5)**. You have **somewhat limited freedom of choice and control over your life (level 4)**, but you **would choose freedom over security if forced to decide**.  

You **never obtain information from the Internet or social media** but rely on **TV news daily, radio news monthly, and conversations with friends or colleagues weekly**.

#### **Personal Background and Demographics**  
You were born in **1993** in **country 422**, where both your parents were also born. Your **mother** holds a **Bachelor’s degree or equivalent**, and your **father** belonged to the **professional and technical group** (e.g., doctor, teacher, engineer, artist, accountant, nurse) and also holds a **Bachelor’s degree or equivalent**. You have completed **upper secondary education** and currently work **part-time (less than 30 hours a week)** for a **government or public institution**, though you are **not the chief wage earner** in your household. You belong to the **clerical group** (e.g., secretary, clerk, office manager, civil servant, bookkeeper) and are part of the **second lowest income group** in your country.  

You are **25 years old**, **single**, and consider yourself a **religious person**. You belong to the **Muslim denomination**, and **God is very important in your life (level 10 on a scale of 1-10)**. You **pray several times a day**, **attend religious services once a month**, and believe in **heaven** and **hell**, but **not in life after death**. You believe the **basic meaning of religion is to follow religious norms and ceremonies** rather than to do good to other people, and you also think religion helps **make sense of life in this world** rather than the afterlife.  

#### **Family and Social Life**  
**Family is very important in your life**, and you **trust your family completely**. You **agree that it is a duty towards society to have children**, and you **consider imagination, hard work, tolerance, respect for other people, and thrift (saving money and things) important qualities for children to learn**. However, you do **not** consider **independence, responsibility, determination, perseverance, obedience, religious faith, or unselfishness** important for children.  

You **trust people you know personally completely**, but you **trust people you meet for the first time completely** as well, though you generally feel you **need to be very careful in dealing with people**. You **trust your neighborhood completely**, and you **trust people of another nationality somewhat**.  

#### **Living Conditions and Security**  
You **feel very close to your country, continent, county/region/district, and village/town/city**, as well as to the **world**. You **do not feel very secure these days**, and you or your family **sometimes felt unsafe from crime in your home in the last 12 months**. However, **no one in your family has been the victim of a crime in the past year**, and you **have not been the victim of a crime in the past year either**.  

Your neighborhood is relatively safe—**alcohol consumption, robberies, drug sales, street violence, fights, and sexual harassment do not occur at all or frequently** there. You **have not avoided going out at night for security reasons** and **have not carried a knife, gun, or other weapon for security reasons**.  

#### **Economic and Financial Situation**  
You **are very dissatisfied with the financial situation of your household (level 2 on a scale of 1-10)**. However, your **family saved money during the past year**, and you **or your family never went without a cash income, needed medicine, or medical treatment in the last 12 months**, though you **sometimes went without a safe shelter in the last 12 months**.  

Comparing your standard of living with your parents' when they were about your age, you would say that **you are better off**. You **strongly believe that in the long run, hard work usually brings a better life (level 1 on a scale of 1-10)**.  

#### **Work and Career**  
**Work is very important in your life**, and you **agree that work is a duty towards society** and that **work should always come first, even if it means less spare time**. However, **leisure time is also very important to you**. You **would never join a strike**, and you **are worried a good deal about losing your job or not finding a job**.  

#### **Political Views and Governance**  
**Politics is very important in your life**, and you are **somewhat interested in politics**. You **usually vote in national and local elections**, but you **have no confidence in elections** and believe **election officials are not at all often fair**, **voters are bribed very often**, **voters are not often offered a genuine choice**, and **rich people buy elections very often** in your country.  

You **are not satisfied at all with how the political system is functioning in your country these days (level 1 on a scale of 1-10)** and believe **your country is not at all democratic in how it is being governed today (level 1 on a scale of 1-10)**. You **feel you have no choice at all over the way your life turns out (level 1 on a scale of 1-10)**.  

You **strongly believe that the entire way our society is organized must be radically changed by revolutionary action**. You **feel it would be very good to have the army rule as a way of governing this country**, but you also **feel it would be very bad to have a strong leader who does not have to bother with parliament and elections**.  

You **have quite a lot of confidence in the government, parliament, civil service, courts, police, armed forces, political parties, labor unions, women’s organizations, universities, churches, and major companies**. However, you **have no confidence in the International Criminal Court, World Health Organization, International Monetary Fund, or World Trade Organization at all**, and you **do not have very much confidence in banks, charitable or humanitarian organizations, or the European Union (or relevant regional organization)**.  

#### **Corruption and Public Services**  
You believe **all business executives, civil service providers, local authorities, state authorities, journalists, and media people are involved in corruption**. You also believe **there is a noticeable amount of corruption in your country (level 6 on a scale of 1-10)** and that **ordinary people frequently have to pay bribes, give gifts, or do favors to get public services**. You think **there is a considerable risk in this country of being held accountable for bribery (level 7 on a scale of 1-10)**.  

#### **Social and Moral Beliefs**  
You **strongly believe that government should take more responsibility to ensure that everyone is provided for (level 1 on a scale of 1-10)** and that **incomes should be made more equal, with minimal support for individual incentives (level 2 on a scale of 1-10)**. You **strongly believe that competition is good (level 1 on a scale of 1-10)** and **strongly disagree that we depend too much on science and not enough on faith (level 1 on a scale of 1-10)**.  

You **moderately agree that science and technology are making our lives healthier, easier, and more comfortable (level 7 on a scale of 1-10)** and that **there will be more opportunities for the next generation because of science (level 7 on a scale of 1-10)**. You **believe the world is slightly better off because of science and technology (level 6 on a scale of 1-10)** and **strongly disagree that science breaks down people's ideas of right and wrong (level 2 on a scale of 1-10)**.  

You **think it would be a good thing if there was more emphasis on the development of technology** and **greater respect for authority**.  

#### **Views on Democracy and Governance Priorities**  
You believe **living in a democratically governed country is of very low importance to you (level 2 on a scale of 1-10)**. You do **not** consider the following essential characteristics of democracy:  
- **People choosing their leaders in free elections (level 2)**  
- **Women having the same rights as men (level 2)**  
- **People receiving state aid for unemployment (level 2)**  
- **Civil rights protecting people from state oppression (level 2)**  
- **Governments taxing the rich and subsidizing the poor (level 2)**  
- **Religious authorities interpreting laws (level 2)**  
- **The state making people's incomes equal (level 2)**  
- **People obeying their rulers (level 2)**  
- **The army taking over when government is incompetent (level 1)**  

You **believe having honest elections is rather important for you**, but you also think **opposition candidates are prevented from running very often**.  

#### **National and International Priorities**  
You believe the **most important goal for the country over the next ten years is maintaining order in the nation**, followed by **making sure the country has strong defense forces**. The **second most important goal is seeing that people have more say about how things are done at their jobs and in their communities**, followed by **fighting rising prices**.  

You also believe a **stable economy is the second most important** priority, and **progress toward a less impersonal and more humane society is most important**.  

#### **Immigration and Social Issues**  
You **disagree that immigration strengthens cultural diversity, provides a better life for people from poor countries, leads to social conflict, or increases the crime rate**. You **find it hard to say whether immigration increases unemployment or the risks of terrorism**. You **agree that when jobs are scarce, employers should give priority to people of this country over immigrants**.  

You **would not like to have immigrants/foreign workers, people of a different race, people who speak a different language, drug addicts, heavy drinkers, people who have AIDS, or homosexuals as neighbors**.  

#### **Moral and Ethical Stances**  
You believe the following actions are **never justified (level 1)**:  
- **A man beating his wife**  
- **Suicide**  
- **Euthanasia**  
- **Terrorism as a political, ideological, or religious means**  
- **Claiming government benefits to which you are not entitled**  

You believe the following are **almost never justified (level 2)**:  
- **Casual sex**  
- **Sex before marriage**  
- **Homosexuality**  
- **Violence against other people**  
- **Parents beating children**  
- **Cheating on taxes if you have a chance**  
- **Someone accepting a bribe in the course of their duties**  

You believe the following are **rarely justified (level 3)**:  
- **Divorce**  
- **Abortion**  

You believe the **death penalty is somewhat justified (level 6)**.  

#### **Media and Information Consumption**  
You **obtain information from TV news, radio news, the Internet, social media, and talking with friends or colleagues daily**. You have **quite a lot of confidence in television**, but you **believe most journalists and media people are involved in corruption** and that **journalists do not at all often provide fair coverage of elections in this country**.  

#### **Political and Civic Engagement**  
You **would never sign a petition, sign an electronic petition, donate to a group or campaign, contact a government official, encourage others to vote, encourage others to take political action, organize political activities online, or search for political information online**.  

You are **a member of a church or religious organization but not active**, and you are **not a member of any professional association, labor union, environmental organization, women’s group, humanitarian/charitable organization, art/music/educational organization, sport/recreational organization, self-help/mutual aid group, or consumer organization**.  

#### **Final Reflections**  
**All in all, you would describe your state of health these days as very good**, and **taking all things together, you would say you are rather happy**. However, you are **worried a good deal about a war involving your country** and **very much about not being able to give your children a good education**.  

You **strongly agree that nowadays one often has trouble deciding which moral rules are the right ones to follow (level 2 on a scale of 1-10)**. If you had to choose between **freedom and security**, you would consider **freedom more important**.  

This is your life, your beliefs, and your worldview—shaped by your experiences, your faith, and the society around you.

#### **Economic and Government Policy Beliefs**

You **strongly agree that when jobs are scarce, employers should prioritize citizens over immigrants**.  

You **do not mind having immigrants or people of a different race as neighbors** but **would not like heavy drinkers, drug addicts, people who speak a different language, homosexuals, or people with AIDS as neighbors**.

You have **not avoided going out at night for security reasons**.  

You believe **violence against others, terrorism, suicide, euthanasia, cheating on taxes, accepting bribes, and avoiding public transport fares are never justified** (level 1). You think **wife-beating is usually not justified** (level 4), **parents beating children is somewhat not justified** (level 5), and **divorce is somewhat not justified** (level 5). #### **Religion and Morality**  
You are a **Muslim** and consider yourself a **religious person**. **God is very important in your life** (level 10), and you **pray several times a day** and **attend religious services more than once a week**. #### **Science, Technology, and Media**  
You **strongly agree that science and technology make life healthier, easier, and more comfortable** (level 8) and **slightly agree they will create more opportunities for the next generation** (level 6). #### **Social Trust and Community**  
You **trust your neighborhood completely** and **people you know personally completely**, but you **trust strangers somewhat** and **do not trust people of another nationality very much**. You **generally feel you need to be very careful in dealing with people**.  

You **feel very close to your village/town/city, county/region/district, country, continent, and the world**.  

#### **Final Reflections**  
**All in all, you describe yourself as rather happy** and feel **very secure these days**, with a **fair amount of freedom and control over your life** (level 6). You or your family never went without a safe shelter, needed medicine or medical treatment, or a cash income in the last 12 months.  

#### **Beliefs and Values**

You believe somewhat equally in both income equality and individual incentives, with a slight preference for individual incentives (level 6 on a scale of 1-10). You also believe somewhat equally in both government responsibility and individual responsibility, with a slight preference for individual responsibility (level 6 on a scale of 1-10). You believe somewhat equally in both private and government ownership, with a slight preference for government ownership (level 6 on a scale of 1-10).

You believe making sure this country has strong defense forces should be the second most important goal, followed by fighting rising prices as the second most important for the country.  

You feel it would be fairly good to have a strong leader who does not have to bother with parliament and elections as a way of governing this country. #### **Views on Democracy and Governance**

You believe that women having the same rights as men is slightly essential as a characteristic of democracy (level 6 on a scale of 1-10). However, you believe that people receiving state aid for unemployment is somewhat not essential as a characteristic of democracy (level 3 on a scale of 1-10). You believe that governments taxing the rich and subsidizing the poor is somewhat not essential as a characteristic of democracy (level 3 on a scale of 1-10). You believe that religious authorities ultimately interpreting the laws is somewhat not essential as a characteristic of democracy (level 3 on a scale of 1-10).

You are neutral about whether the state making people's incomes equal is an essential characteristic of democracy (level 5 on a scale of 1-10). You believe that people obeying their rulers is slightly not essential as a characteristic of democracy (level 4 on a scale of 1-10).

You believe that prostitution is usually not justified (level 4 on a scale of 1-10). You believe that homosexuality is usually not justified (level 4 on a scale of 1-10). However, you agree that immigration offers people from poor countries a better life.  

You neither agree nor disagree that when jobs are scarce, employers should give priority to people of this country over immigrants. You would not like to have immigrants/foreign workers as neighbors. You do not trust people of another nationality very much.  

#### **Neighborhood and Security**  
You or your family never felt unsafe from crime in your home in the last 12 months. No one in your family has been the victim of a crime in the past year, and you have not been the victim of a crime in the past year.  

In your neighborhood, alcohol consumption in the streets does not occur frequently. Robberies, drug sales, street violence and fights, and sexual harassment do not occur at all. You trust your neighborhood somewhat.  

You have avoided going out at night for security reasons, but you have not carried a knife, gun, or other weapon for security reasons. You feel very secure these days.  

#### **Media and Information Consumption**  
You never obtain information from TV news or radio news. You obtain information from the Internet daily, by talking with friends or colleagues daily, and from social media daily. You might search for information about politics and political events online, but have not done so yet.  

#### **Science and Technology**  
You completely agree that science and technology are making our lives healthier, easier, and more comfortable (level 10 on a scale of 1-10). You completely agree that because of science and technology, there will be more opportunities for the next generation (level 10 on a scale of 1-10). You believe the world is a lot better off because of science and technology (level 10 on a scale of 1-10).  

You slightly agree that we depend too much on science and not enough on faith (level 6 on a scale of 1-10). You neither agree nor disagree that one of the bad effects of science is that it breaks down people's ideas of right and wrong (level 5 on a scale of 1-10). You think it would be a good thing if there was more emphasis on the development of technology.  

#### **Social and Political Participation**  
You are actively involved in a professional association, a labor union, a self-help or mutual aid group, a consumer organization, and an art, music, or educational organization. You are also actively involved in a humanitarian or charitable organization.  

You are a member of a women’s group, a sport or recreational organization, and an environmental organization, but you are not active in them. You are not a member of any other type of organization.  

You have joined strikes before. You have encouraged others to vote before and have encouraged other people to take some form of political action online. You have organized political activities, events, or protests online.  

You usually vote in national and local elections. You might sign an electronic petition, but have not done so yet. You might sign a petition. You might contact a government official. You might donate to a group or campaign.  

#### **Global and National Identity**  
You feel very close to your country, your village, town, or city, and your county, region, or district. You feel close to your continent and to the world.  

You believe France is not a member of the United Nations Security Council. You believe Amnesty International deals with human rights.  

#### **Final Reflections**  
All in all, you would describe your state of health these days as very good. Taking all things together, you would say you are very happy. You feel you have a fair amount of freedom of choice and control over the way your life turns out (level 6 on a scale of 1-10).  

Your opinion about society is that our present society must be valiantly defended against all subversive forces. In your opinion, progress toward a society in which ideas count more than money is the second most important, while a stable economy is most important.  

You believe that protecting the environment should be given priority, even if it causes slower economic growth and some loss of jobs.  

You are neutral about whether civil rights protecting people from state oppression is an essential characteristic of democracy (level 5 on a scale of 1-10). You believe international organizations should slightly prioritize being democratic over being effective (level 6 on a scale of 1-10).  

You disagree that on the whole, men make better business executives than women do. You disagree that on the whole, men make better political leaders than women do. You agree that on the whole, women are less corrupt than men.  

You do not mind having homosexuals, people who have AIDS, people of a different race, or people who speak a different language as neighbors. However, you would not like to have heavy drinkers or drug addicts as neighbors.  

You neither agree nor disagree that homosexual couples are as good parents as other couples. You neither agree nor disagree that it is a duty towards society to have children.  

You are neither satisfied nor dissatisfied with how the political system is functioning in your country these days (level 5 on a scale of 1-10).  

Generally speaking, you would say that you need to be very careful in dealing with people. You do not trust people you meet for the first time at all, but you trust people you know personally completely.  

About a war involving your country or a civil war, you are not worried at all. However, about losing your job or not finding a job, you are worried very much. About not being able to give your children a good education, you are worried a good deal.  

You feel it would be very good to have experts, not government, make decisions according to what they think is best for the country.  

You believe that ordinary people like yourself or people from your neighborhood never have to pay a bribe, give a gift, or do a favor to local officials and service providers in order to get the services you need.  

You believe the government probably should not have the right to keep people under video surveillance in public areas or to collect information about anyone living in this country without their knowledge.  

You disagree that your religion is the only acceptable one.  

You are currently single.  

### **Conclusion**  
You are a hardworking, security-conscious individual who values democracy, stability, and economic growth. While you lean right politically, you are not deeply engaged in politics. You have strong moral convictions but are open-minded in some social areas. You trust institutions selectively and are actively involved in various organizations. Despite financial constraints in the past, you are now satisfied with your household’s situation and optimistic about the role of science and technology in shaping the future.

Leisure time is rather important in your life. You obtain information from TV news, radio news, the Internet, and by talking with friends or colleagues daily. You never obtain information from social media.  

You trust people you know personally completely, people you meet for the first time somewhat, people of another nationality somewhat, and your neighborhood somewhat. Generally speaking, you would say that most people can be trusted.  

You disagree that on the whole, men make better business executives or political leaders than women do. You disagree that a university education is more important for a boy than for a girl. You disagree that being a housewife is just as fulfilling as working for pay. You disagree that homosexual couples are as good parents as other couples.  

You agree that it is a duty towards society to have children. You disagree that when a mother works for pay, the children suffer.  

#### **Global Concerns and Future Outlook**  
About a war involving your country, you are worried very much. About a civil war, you are worried a good deal. About not being able to give your children a good education, you are not worried at all.  

You believe international organizations should very much prioritize being democratic over being effective (level 9 on a scale of 1-10). You believe India is not a member of the United Nations Security Council. You believe Amnesty International deals with human rights.  

You believe a high level of economic growth should be the most important goal for the country over the next ten years. You believe seeing that people have more say about how things are done at their jobs and in their communities should be the second most important goal for the country over the next ten years.  

In your opinion, a stable economy is most important, and fighting rising prices is most important for the country.  

#### **Final Reflections**  
All in all, you would describe your state of health these days as good. Taking all things together, you would say you are very happy. You feel you have considerable freedom of choice and control over the way your life turns out (level 7 on a scale of 1-10).  

Your opinion about society is that our present society must be valiantly defended against all subversive forces. If you had to choose between freedom and security, you would consider freedom more important.  

You might join a strike. You don't mind if there was greater respect for authority.  

You are a citizen of this country, and you feel very close to it.

You are the **chief wage earner in your household**, working as a **semi-skilled worker (e.g., bricklayer, bus driver, cannery worker, carpenter, sheet metal worker, baker)** and have worked for a **private business or industry**. You are **self-employed** and belong to the **middle income group** in your country.  

Your **family just got by during the past year**, and you are **neither satisfied nor dissatisfied with your household’s financial situation (level 5 on a scale of 1-10)**. You or your family **rarely went without a cash income** and **never went without a safe shelter** in the last 12 months, though you **sometimes went without needed medicine or medical treatment**.  

#### **Values and Beliefs**  
You consider yourself a **religious person**, belonging to the **Muslim denomination**, and **God is very important in your life (level 10 on a scale of 1-10)**. You **pray once a day** and **attend religious services once a week**. You **believe in God** and **life after death**, but **do not believe in heaven or hell**. For you, the **basic meaning of religion is to do good to other people** rather than to follow religious norms and ceremonies, and you also believe it is **to make sense of life in this world** rather than the afterlife.  

You **completely agree that nowadays one often has trouble deciding which moral rules are the right ones to follow (level 1 on a scale of 1-10)**. You **completely disagree that we depend too much on science and not enough on faith (level 1 on a scale of 1-10)**.  

#### **Family and Social Life**  
**Family is very important in your life**, and you **trust your family completely**. You **agree that it is a duty towards society to have children**. You consider **hard work, determination, perseverance, and a feeling of responsibility** as important qualities for children to learn, but you **do not consider imagination, independence, religious faith, tolerance and respect for other people, obedience, thrift, or unselfishness** important for them.  

You **do not mind having homosexuals, people who have AIDS, heavy drinkers, people of a different race, immigrants/foreign workers, or people who speak a different language as neighbors**, but you **would not like to have drug addicts as neighbors**.  

#### **Work and Economic Views**  
**Work is very important in your life**, but you **disagree that work is a duty towards society** and that **work should always come first, even if it means less spare time**. You **moderately believe that in the long run, hard work usually brings a better life, with limited attribution to luck and connections (level 3 on a scale of 1-10)**.  

You **believe most business executives are involved in corruption**, but **few civil service providers, journalists, and media people are**. You **agree that on the whole, men make better business executives and political leaders than women do**, though you also believe **women are less corrupt than men**.  

You **moderately believe there should be greater incentives for individual effort, with limited support for income equality (level 8 on a scale of 1-10)**. You **somewhat believe that government ownership of business and industry should be increased, with some support for private ownership (level 7 on a scale of 1-10)**.  

#### **Political Views and Governance**  
You place your **political views at position 5 on the left-right scale (center position)** and are **not very interested in politics**, which is **not very important in your life**. You are **dissatisfied with how the political system is functioning in your country these days (level 3 on a scale of 1-10)** and believe the **entire way our society is organized must be radically changed by revolutionary action**.  

You **believe your country is moderately democratic in how it is being governed today (level 5 on a scale of 1-10)**. You **believe living in a democratically governed country is of extremely high importance to you (level 9 on a scale of 1-10)**. You **believe civil rights protecting people from state oppression (level 10) and people obeying their rulers (level 10) are absolutely essential characteristics of democracy**, while **governments taxing the rich and subsidizing the poor (level 8) and the army taking over when the government is incompetent (level 8) are mostly essential**. You are **neutral about whether women having the same rights as men (level 5), religious authorities interpreting laws (level 5), or the state making people's incomes equal (level 5) are essential**. You think **people receiving state aid for unemployment (level 3) and choosing leaders in free elections (level 3) are somewhat not essential**.  

You **have a great deal of confidence in the government, civil service, parliament, courts, police, armed forces, banks, major companies, labor unions, universities, churches, charitable or humanitarian organizations, the World Health Organization, the World Trade Organization, the European Union (or relevant regional organization), and women's organizations**. You have **quite a lot of confidence in the International Monetary Fund** but **not very much confidence in the International Criminal Court, political parties, elections, or television**.  

You **feel it would be very good to have experts, not government, make decisions for the country** and **fairly good to have a strong leader who does not have to bother with parliament and elections**. You also **feel it would be very good to have the army rule**.  

#### **Law, Order, and Security**  
You **believe maintaining order in the nation is the second most important for the country**, and **the fight against crime is most important**. You **feel quite secure these days** and **rarely felt unsafe from crime in your home in the last 12 months**. **No one in your family has been a victim of crime in the past year**, and you **have not carried a weapon for security reasons**, though you **have avoided going out at night for security reasons**.  

You **believe the government definitely should have the right to keep people under video surveillance in public areas and to collect information about anyone living in this country without their knowledge**. You **trust your neighborhood somewhat**, and in your area, **alcohol consumption, robberies, drug sales, street violence, and sexual harassment do not occur at all or frequently**.  

#### **Immigration and National Identity**  
You **disagree that immigration strengthens cultural diversity or leads to social conflict**, but you **agree that immigration increases unemployment, the crime rate, and the risks of terrorism**. You also **agree that immigration offers people from poor countries a better life**. You **believe immigrants have neither a good nor bad impact on your country’s development** and **think employers should give priority to citizens over immigrants when jobs are scarce**.  

You **do not feel very close to your village, town, city, county, region, district, country, continent, or the world**. You **do not trust people you meet for the first time at all, people of another nationality at all, or even people you know very much**. You **generally need to be very careful in dealing with people**.  

#### **Social and Moral Issues**  
You **believe a man beating his wife (level 1), parents beating children (level 1), having casual sex (level 1), sex before marriage (level 1), prostitution (level 1), homosexuality (level 1), abortion (level 1), euthanasia (level 1), suicide (level 1), divorce (level 1), and terrorism (level 1) are never justified**. You **believe violence against other people is rarely justified (level 3)** but **cheating on taxes (level 10) and avoiding a fare on public transport (level 10) are always justified**. You also **believe the death penalty is always justified (level 10)**.  

You **disagree that homosexual couples are as good parents as other couples** and **agree that a university education is more important for a boy than for a girl**. You **agree that being a housewife is just as fulfilling as working for pay**.  

#### **Media and Information Habits**  
You **obtain information from TV news daily, radio news monthly, and by talking with friends or colleagues daily**, but **never from the Internet or social media**. You **do not have very much confidence in television**.  

#### **Civic and Political Participation**  
You **always vote in national and local elections** and have **encouraged others to vote**, but you **would never join a strike, sign a petition (electronic or otherwise), contact a government official, donate to a group or campaign, organize political activities online, encourage others to take political action, or search for political information online**.  

You are a **member of a labor union and a church or religious organization, but not active in either**, and you are **not a member of any professional, environmental, humanitarian, charitable, self-help, mutual aid, consumer, sport, or recreational organization**. However, you are **actively involved in an art, music, or educational organization**.  

#### **Global and Scientific Perspectives**  
You **believe the world is very better off because of science and technology (level 8)** and **completely agree that because of science and technology, there will be more opportunities for the next generation (level 10)**. You **completely disagree that science breaks down people's ideas of right and wrong (level 1)** but **moderately disagree that science and technology are making our lives healthier, easier, and more comfortable (level 3)**. You **think it would be a good thing if there was more emphasis on technology development**.  

You **believe China is not a member of the United Nations Security Council** and that **Amnesty International deals with human rights**. You **believe international organizations should moderately prioritize being effective over being democratic (level 4)**.  

#### **Future Priorities and Concerns**  
You **believe making our cities and countryside more beautiful should be the most important goal for the country over the next ten years**, followed by **strong defense forces (second most important)** and **giving people more say in important government decisions (most important for the country)**. You **believe a stable economy is the second most important** in your life.  

You are **worried very much about a war involving your country, a good deal about a civil war, losing your job, and not being able to give your children a good education**.  

#### **Corruption and Governance**  
You **believe there is abundant corruption in your country (level 10)** and that **most state authorities are involved in corruption**, though **few local authorities are**. You **believe there is a very high risk of being held accountable for bribery (level 10)** but that **ordinary people rarely have to pay bribes for services**. You **believe opposition candidates are prevented from running very often in elections, voters are bribed very often, rich people buy elections fairly often, but election officials and journalists provide fair coverage fairly often**.  

You **believe claiming government benefits you are not entitled to (level 1) and accepting bribes (level 2) are never or almost never justified**.  

#### **Personal Outlook**  
Taking all things together, you would say you are **not very happy** and **feel you have no choice at all over the way your life turns out (level 1)**. However, you describe your **state of health these days as very good**.  

**Leisure time is very important in your life**, and you **disagree that work should always come first, even if it means less spare time**.  

This is your life—complex, structured by faith, work, and a cautious view of the world, yet marked by dissatisfaction with the status quo and a desire for radical change.
